program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Personal Piano Lessons: Wed
activity_description: It's never too early to develop your musical talent! Book one-on-one 30-minute piano lessons with an experienced instructor. Participants will receive more detailed information about lesson materials on their first day. These lessons are booked in 30 minute slots. To book a time slot, please call Laurelhurst CC @ 206-684-7529 to schedule your private lesson time slot. No Class 2/19/25.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Piano - Jan - Feb - Mar (6 and older)
activity_name: Piano - Jan - Feb - Mar (6 and older)
activity_description: It's never too early (or late!) to develop your musical talent! Book one-on-one 30-minute piano lessons with a seasoned musician. Participants will receive more detailed information about lesson materials on their first day.  *Note: The lessons are booked in 35-minute time slots, however, the lessons are only 30 minutes, the last 5 minutes are required for sanitizing the room. Call Northgate CC @ 206-386-4283 to schedule your classes. Lessons are $46 dollars a class. Total cost of classes due the first of each month. First payment is due at registration.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Piano - Jan-Mar (Fri)
activity_description: It's never too early (or late!) to develop your musical talent! Book one-on-one 30-minute piano lessons with a seasoned musician. Participants will receive more detailed information about lesson materials on their first day.  *Note: The lessons are booked in 45-minute time slots, however, the lessons are only 30 minutes, the last 15 minutes are required for sanitizing the room. Call Green Lake CC @ 206-684-0780 to schedule your classes. Lessons are $60 dollars a class. Total cost of classes due the first of each month. First payment is due at registration.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Piano Lessons (Sat) Jan-Mar
activity_description: Learn to play the piano from an experienced professional teacher in weekly 30-minute private lessons. Training includes sight-reading, technique, expression, theory, and chords. Please contact Bitter Lake Community Center at (206) 684-7524 for times and any other inquiries.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Piano Lessons (Thu) Jan-Mar
activity_description: Learn to play the piano from an experienced professional teacher in weekly 30-minute private lessons. Training includes sight-reading, technique, expression, theory, and chords. Please contact Bitter Lake Community Center at (206) 684-7524 for times and any other inquiries.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Pre Ballet
activity_description: Students experience the joy of dancing as they learn the basics of ballet technique and creative dance. Motor skills, posture, coordination, and musicality are emphasized through games, exercise, and choreography. Students should wear ballet shoes, dance attire, and have long hair pulled back.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Traditional and Contemporary Asian Dance
activity_description: Have fun while learning new dance moves influenced by Malaysian, Chinese and Vietnamese dance. All levels welcome. Class is taught in Mandarin, Cantonese and English. Registration is required for this free class. Instructor: K. Luo

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Ballet Fitness - I
activity_description: Strengthen your body through the beautiful  movements of ballet.     Exercises at the barre and center floor. *No fragrances.     Ballet slippers or cotton socks. Snug  fitting clothing desired.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Creative Dance -Session 1
activity_description: Students will explore expressive movement using music, stories, and props. We will focus on developing motor skills, balance, and coordination along with imagination and creativity. A variety of dance concepts and vocabulary will be introduced in a fun, safe, and engaging way. Please bring your own water bottle.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Creative Dance -Session 2
activity_description: Students will explore expressive movement using music, stories, and props. We will focus on developing motor skills, balance, and coordination along with imagination and creativity. A variety of dance concepts and vocabulary will be introduced in a fun, safe, and engaging way. Please bring your own water bottle.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Family Dance with Teacher Marika (2-4yrs)
activity_description: Students engage in fun, movement-based activities that strengthen physical coordination, social emotional skills, and brain development. Through music, props, and dance, we explore our imagination and creativity. This is a joyful and inclusive class for dancers and their caregivers. Caregiver participation required. Non-walking babies ages 0-2 welcome under caregiver supervision. All walking babies must be registered.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Family Dance with Teacher Marika (2-4yrs)
activity_description: Students engage in fun, movement-based activities that strengthen physical coordination, social emotional skills, and brain development. Through music, props, and dance, we explore our imagination and creativity. This is a joyful and inclusive class for dancers and their caregivers. Caregiver participation required. Non-walking babies ages 0-2 welcome under caregiver supervision. All walking babies must be registered.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Music Mondays for Families
activity_description: Children and their families will engage in rhymes, singing,  activities, and movement using a creative arts-based programming. Participants  can play together and be introduced to different instruments and sounds.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Music Mondays for Families
activity_description: Children and their families will engage in rhymes, singing,  activities, and movement using a creative arts-based programming. Participants  can play together and be introduced to different instruments and sounds.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Parent and Tot Music Class - Session 1
activity_name: Parent and Tot Music Class - Session 1
activity_description: Let your little ones learn music, as you release your own inner diva! Kids will have the opportunity to learn basic musical skills while playing, moving, and interacting with each other and their parents or caregivers. Wear comfortable clothing and come prepared to move and sing.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Parent and Tot Music Class - Session 2
activity_name: Parent and Tot Music Class - Session 2
activity_description: Let your little ones learn music, as you release your own inner diva! Kids will have the opportunity to learn basic musical skills while playing, moving, and interacting with each other and their parents or caregivers. Wear comfortable clothing and come prepared to move and sing.

Motor skills, posture, coordination, and musicality are emphasized through games, exercises, and choreography. Students should wear ballet shoes, dance attire, and have long hair pulled back.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Ballet 1 Session 1
activity_description: We will develop ballet skills and vocabulary while inspiring creativity and expression.  Students will learn the fundamentals, and Barre and center work will be  introduced, as well as combinations and choreography. Students should wear  ballet slippers or bare feet, close fitting attire, and have their hair pulled  off the face. All students welcome. Please bring your own water bottle.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Ballet 1 Session 2
activity_description: We will develop ballet skills and vocabulary while inspiring creativity and expression.  Students will learn the fundamentals, and Barre and center work will be  introduced, as well as combinations and choreography. Students should wear  ballet slippers or bare feet, close fitting attire, and have their hair pulled  off the face. All students welcome. Please bring your own water bottle.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Contemporary Dance: Ages 8-12
activity_description: Dive into expressive movement that blends ballet, lyrical, and modern dance technique.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Contemporary Dance: Ages 8-12
activity_description: Dive into expressive movement that blends ballet, lyrical, and modern dance technique. No Class 3/6

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Creative Dance Session 1 (3-5 yrs)
activity_description: Young dancers experience the joy of dancing by learning the basics of movement and self-expression. A focus on how the body moves and musicality are emphasized through games, improvisation, and choreography. Students should wear clothes that promote comfort.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Creative Dance Session 2 (3-5 yrs)
activity_description: Young dancers experience the joy of dancing by learning the basics of movement and self-expression. A focus on how the body moves and musicality are emphasized through games, improvisation, and choreography. Students should wear clothes that promote comfort.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Explore the Recorder: Beginner
activity_description: Find out what the  recorder is all about in this fun, judgement free musical zone. Students will learn  basic music and recorder concepts including identifying notes, rhythm, and  playing skills. Students should bring their own soprano recorder. If that is an  issue, please contact the staff at 206-684-7522.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Explore the Recorder: Beyond Beginner
activity_description: Students will continue  to explore additional music and recorder  concepts including working on more   rhythms, and music styles.  For  anyone interested in boosting their   beginner skills in a fun and judgement free musical zone. Students  are  responsible for bringing their own  soprano recorder to use, if this is not   possible, please contact the staff at 206-684-7522.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: GuitarsNotGuns Guitar Lessons
activity_description: Join our 8-week guitar lessons for  youth. No guitar, No worries! Instruction, instrument, and a safe environment  are all provided. All you need to do is be there for each lesson over 8 weeks,  and upon course completion you'll have the opportunity to own your guitar- in  some cases, free!

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Mini Tap and Jazz: Ages 5-7
activity_description: A fun blend of tap and jazz styles, this class will teach you rhythm, coordination, and show-stopping moves. Tap shoes and Jazz shoes required.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Pre-Ballet Session 1 (5-7yrs)
activity_description: Students experience the joy of dancing as they learn the basics of ballet technique and creative dance. Motor skills, posture, coordination, and musicality are emphasized through games, exercises, and choreography. Students should wear ballet shoes, dance attire, and have long hair pulled back.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Reach for the Star: Ages 8-12
activity_description: For those who love the spotlight, this class combines energetic jazz movements and theatrics.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Reach for the Stars: Ages 8-12
activity_description: For those who love the spotlight, this class combines energetic jazz movements and theatrics.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Reach for the Stars: Pop Dance Fusion
activity_name: Reach for the Stars: Pop Dance Fusion
activity_description: Join us for an energetic       dance class that blends pop, jazz, and hip hop with theatrical flair!       Inspired by popular songs and musicals, students will learn fun routines       that encourage creativity and confidence while having a blast on the dance       floor!

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Tap and Jazz: Beginner
activity_description: Explore rhythms, body-mind coordination, and musicality while learning basic tap and jazz movements set to upbeat music. Each class will combine individual and combinations of dance skills and will build on the pre-requisite class, Beginning Tap and Jazz. Tap shoes and Jazz or Ballet shoes required.

program_description: Seattle Parks and Recreation program: Volunteers Orientation
activity_description: Make an impact in your community! Lifelong Recreation SW is currently seeking assistant instructors for beginner pickleball classes and leaders of outdoor walks and urban hikes.  Register here to open a conversation with our volunteer coordinator and to join our Seattle Parks team.  Orientation will be online via Teams.
